title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

title: How token burns affect price, and when they don’t
summary: Token burning only raises prices when demand, utility and transparency align. Here’s when supply cuts work, and why SHIB and BNB tell different stories.

title: MEV is a choice blockchains must confront
summary: MEV isn’t inevitable. It’s engineered exploitation masquerading as necessity. Blockchain’s future depends on eliminating this hidden tax on users.

title: Metaplanet taps $100M Bitcoin-backed loan for BTC purchases, share buyback
summary: The loan came shortly after Metaplanet launched a $500 million Bitcoin-backed share buyback program, after its market-based net asset value fell below 1.0.

title: Bull or bear market? Traders panic as Bitcoin dips below 365-day average
summary: After dropping under its 365-day moving average price, Bitcoin faces uncertainty as analysts weigh whether it signals a looming bear market or a brief pullback.

title: Bitcoin price 21% dip ‘normal’ as accumulator wallets buy 50K BTC in day
summary: Bitcoin accumulators bought 375,000 BTC in just 30 days, with the dip below $100,000 boosting their holdings by 50,000 BTC on Tuesday, new data confirmed.

title: Bitcoin ‘bear market’ confirmed: Watch these BTC price levels next
summary: Bitcoin traded 20% below its all-time high of $126,000 as key onchain and technical indicators suggest that BTC has entered a new bear market.

title: NFTs hit the brakes: Market cap tanks 46% in just 30 days
summary: CoinGecko data shows the NFT market value has nearly halved in a month, with even top collections like BAYC and CryptoPunks losing ground.

title: Arthur Hayes, Bitwise exec still bullish as Bitcoin falls under $100K
summary: Former BitMEX CEO Arthur Hayes said increasing US debt will force the Federal Reserve into “stealth QE,” injecting liquidity that could reignite Bitcoin’s next rally.

title: Bitcoin is infrastructure, not digital gold
summary: Bitcoin’s true potential lies in its infrastructure role as productive capital, not just a digital store of value like gold.
